concise_definition: v. 感觉到, 察觉到, 意识到 (sense 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To become aware of something through intuition, indirect evidence, or subtle cues, rather than through direct observation or explicit communication.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过直觉、间接证据或细微线索察觉到某事物，而非通过直接观察或明确表达。
definitions.example_en: She sensed that something was wrong, even though no one said anything.
definitions.example_cn: 她感觉到出了问题，尽管没有人说出来。

definitions.explanation_en: To perceive or detect something using one of the physical senses, especially when the stimulus is faint or ambiguous.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过某种感官（如听觉、视觉、触觉等）感知或察觉到某物，尤其当刺激微弱或模糊时。
definitions.example_en: He sensed a faint smell of smoke coming from the kitchen.
definitions.example_cn: 他闻到厨房里有一丝烟味。

definitions.explanation_en: To intuitively understand or grasp the underlying meaning, emotion, or intention behind someone's words or actions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指直觉地理解或把握他人言语或行为背后的深层含义、情绪或意图。
definitions.example_en: I sensed he was hiding something, even when he smiled politely.
definitions.example_cn: 即使他礼貌地微笑着，我也感觉到他在隐瞒什么。

comparison.analysis: “Perceived” (感知) 更强调通过感官或认知系统对信息的接收和解释，常用于客观描述认知过程，如视觉或听觉的感知。而 “sensed” 更侧重于一种模糊、直觉或非理性的察觉，常带有情感或潜意识成分。
“Noticed” (注意到) 指有意识地观察到某个明显或突出的事物，通常基于注意力的主动聚焦。而 “sensed” 更倾向于无意识或半意识地捕捉到细微、隐晦的线索，不一定需要主动关注。
“Felt” (感觉) 常用于表达情绪或身体感受，如“felt happy”或“felt pain”，而 “sensed” 更常用于认知性或环境性的察觉，如“sensed danger”或“sensed tension”。虽然两者有时可互换，但 “sensed” 更理性、更间接，而 “felt” 更主观、更情感化。
